text:
Robert Schiller (November 8, 1918 – October 10, 2017) was an American writer. He worked with fellow producer / screenwriter Bob Weiskopf on many television series in the United States, including "I Love Lucy" (1955–1957) and "All in the Family" (1977–1979) on the CBS network. For his work, Schiller received an Emmy Award in 1971 and in 1978.
Schiller died on October 10, 2017 at his home in Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles from congestive heart failure at the age of 98.
